intro: Rochelia karsensis, commonly known as the Karsen's rochelia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Europe. It is characterized by its unique rosette growth form and thick, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in limestone-rich areas. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Rochelia karsensis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
